page.title: 07ST MARY'S CHURCH OF ENGLAND
page.content: The St. Mary's parish contains 800 people.It is situated south of Barnham station. There are 3 services on Sunday and 1 on every other day. There are 20-25 baptisms a year. Next year a Domesday celebration will be held. The church dates from the 11th or early 12th century. Every week the vicar visits Eastergate school, he is also happy to visit other schools.He is trying to find help to run a youth club. The parish raises money for the church by selling home-produced goods. The church is Norman.It has one of the oldest bells in Sussex.St. Mary's Church has had a lot of restoration work on it during the years. This information was provided by Vicar Morrison when interviewed by Catherine Coulthard and Helen Rawlings.
